findings.title: State Variables could be Declared Constant
findings.description: State variables can be declared as constant using the constant keyword to ensure they cannot be changed by any function in the contract.

findings.title: Conformance to Solidity Naming Conventions
findings.description: The contract does not follow the Solidity naming conventions, which can affect readability and maintainability.

findings.title: Dead Code Elimination
findings.description: The contract has dead code that is never executed or reached during normal contract execution.
findings.location: Contract, various functions and code blocks

findings.title: Unnecessary Boolean equality
findings.description: The contract uses unnecessary boolean equalities when comparing two boolean values.

findings.title: Uninitialized Variables in Local Scope
findings.description: The contract uses uninitialized local variables, which can lead to unpredictable behavior and potential errors.
findings.location: Contract, various functions and local variables

findings.title: Multiple Pragma Directives
findings.description: The contract includes multiple conflicting pragma directives, which can produce unexpected errors.

findings.title: Stable Compiler Version
findings.description: The contract uses an unstable compiler version, which can lead to compatibility issues and potential vulnerabilities.
